custom_fields.key_topics: Course topics include antibody engineering, cytokine therapies, T-cell based therapies, vaccine development
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Students should have a good knowledge of fundamental biochemistry in terms of protein and nucleic acid structure. Students should also have a good knowledge of cell biology. Students who have not taken an advanced course in immunology will be provided with the necessary materials to be successful in this course.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: There will two in-class exams, several in-class presentations, weekly homeworks, and a final exam or final paper
custom_fields.goals: Students will be able to read, critique, and present the primary literature related to immunology.They will have a functional understanding of how to use aspects of the immune system to treat disease.
custom_fields.relevance: This is an upper level elective course for those students interested in immunology and applied immunology.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Students will be given review articles and articles from the primary literature.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Nothing beyond normal course demands for preparation of presentations, homework, and studying for assessments. Total time will be 12 hours/week, 3 of which will be spent in class
